title: Ticket #6305: Error messages from slurm not reported well
description:
Fermi reports several instances where error messages from slurm are either badly reported by HTCondor or completely missing.

Submit Errors

When sbatch fails due to system downtime or bad SBATCH parameters, they saw this hold reason, which mainly comes from /etc/issue: 

*********************************************************\n
Attempts to submit failed: * of use. LOG OFF IMMEDIATELY if you do not agree
to the *\n * conditions stated in this warning._*
*\n * *\n ********
*********************************************************\n

They verified that an interactive run of sbatch that fails gives a reasonable error message.

Execution Errors

When a job is killed by slurm for going over its memory limit, they see this error from HTCondor: 

Error parsing classad or job not found

They say the correct error message can be found in the job's stderr file.
